Prof. Dr. Luca Benini Full Professor at the Department of Information Technology and Electrical Engineering ETH Zürich Institut für Integrierte Systeme ETZ J 84 Gloriastrasse 35 8092 Zürich Switzerland Work phone +41 44 632 66 64 phone +41 44 632 42 68 Secretariat(Sec.) call_made0000-0001-8068-3806 contactsV-Card (vcf, 1kb) Additional information Research area Energy-Efficient computer architecture,  Embedded Systems, Digital integrated circuits, Machine Learning Hardware Luca Benini holds the chair of digital Circuits and systems at ETHZ and is Full Professor at the Universita di Bologna. He received a PhD from Stanford University. He has been visiting professor at Stanford University, IMEC, EPFL. He served as chief architect in STmicroelectronics France. Dr. Benini's research interests are in energy-efficient parallel computing systems, smart sensing micro-systems and machine learning hardware. He has published more than 1000 peer-reviewed papers and five books. He is an ERC-advanced grant winner, a Fellow of the IEEE, of the ACM and a member of the Academia Europaea. He is the recipient of the 2016 IEEE CAS Mac Van Valkenburg award, the 2020 EDAA achievement Award, the 2020 ACM/IEEE A. Richard Newton Award and the 2023 IEEE CS E.J. McCluskey Award.
